    • Constructor Detail

      • Transition

        public Transition(java.lang.String _id,
                  Label _label,
                  int _index,
                  TimeSpan _interval,
                  org.javatuples.Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> _guard,
                  java.lang.String _name)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor for transitions with time and guard
        Parameters:
        _id - The transition id
        _label - The transition label object
        _index - The transition index. It must match the petri's column which correspond to this transition
        _interval - TimeSpan object for the timed transition interval
        _guard - Pair name for the variable used as guard for this transition and value that enables the guard.
        _name - A User-defined name. Empty is not allowed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When _index is negative

      • Transition

        public Transition(java.lang.String _id,
                  Label _label,
                  int _index,
                  org.javatuples.Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> _guard,
                  java.lang.String _name)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor for transitions with guard
        Parameters:
        _id - The transition id
        _label - The transition label object
        _index - The transition index. It must match the petri's column which correspond to this transition
        _name - A User-defined name. Empty is not allowed
        _guard - Pair name for the variable used as guard for this transition and value that enables the guard.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When _index is negative

      • Transition

        public Transition(java.lang.String _id,
                  Label _label,
                  int _index,
                  TimeSpan _interval,
                  java.lang.String _name)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This constructor is intended for timed transitions only. If this transition is not timed use Transition(String, Label, int, String)
        Parameters:
        _id - The transition id
        _label - The transition label object
        _index - The transition index. It must match the petri's column which correspond to this transition
        _interval - TimeSpan object for the timed transition interval
        _name - A User-defined name. Empty is not allowed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When _index is negative

      • Transition

        public Transition(java.lang.String _id,
                  Label _label,
                  int _index,
                  java.lang.String _name)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Simple constructor for Transition without time nor guard
        Parameters:
        _id - The transition id
        _label - The transition label object
        _index - The transition index. It must match the petri's column which correspond to this transition
        _name - A User-defined name. Empty is not allowed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When _index is negative

        Returns:

      • getGuardName

        public java.lang.String getGuardName()
        Returns:
        the name for this transition's guard. Empty string if none

      • getGuardEnablingValue

        public boolean getGuardEnablingValue()
        Returns:
        true if the guard is set by low level

      • hasGuard

        public boolean hasGuard()
        Returns:
        true if the transition has a guard

      • isTimed

        public boolean isTimed()
        Returns:
        True if the transition is timed.

      • insideTimeSpan

        public boolean insideTimeSpan(long timestamp)
        Tests whether timestamp is inside this transition's span for timed transitions. For non-timed transitions this method always returns true;
        Parameters:
        timestamp - the time in the format given by System.currentTimeMillis()
        Returns:
        true is timestamp is inside the span

      • isBeforeTimeSpan

        public boolean isBeforeTimeSpan(long timestamp)
        Tests whether timestamp is before this transition's span for timed transitions. For non-timed transitions this method always returns false;
        Parameters:
        timestamp - the time in the format given by System.currentTimeMillis()
        Returns:
        true is timestamp is before the span

      • getEnablingTime

        public long getEnablingTime()
        Returns:
        The enabling timestamp. For non-timed transitions this method returns zero.
